text: Which is the best and easy to integrate database solution to perform bidirectional communication with HubSpot? eg. Postgre? MySQL? or NoSQL?
I would think you’d want to use a javascript api based DB like firebase. if you need to display that data on your HS site.  If you want to interact with a HubDB you need to use the API’s for that

Thanks <@U7SL518D6> , We have some products on our website and website is build in HubSpot. I was thinking if we can get the purchase details in an external database and also if needed from database to HubSpot. I will have a look on Firebase. Hope it works out!

<@UBQSVT1HA>
If you’re trying to do ecommerce then you should look into shopify, there’s a direct integration between shopify and HubSpot, and you can use Shopify’s JS cart and whatnot to enable purchasing on HubSpot.

If you’re simply storing information for display then HubDB is the right way to go
I see. Okay Thanks for help!

Is anyone else having issues sending people HubSpot Preview URLS and it's sending people to a Security Error Page saying the page is dangerous and has Malware and is changing the URL to be something like Sidekick??
Are you sending this in an email that’s tracked in HubSpot sales?
Yeah - is that why?
This co-worker has had HubSpot Sales linked to his email for a while, but the Sidekick thing just became an issue today
I believe so, checking with the team now
thanks!

Yup, that was the issue.  Google incorrectly flagged on of our tracking domains as malicious. It should be resolved now, but definitely let us know if you continue to see issues with link tracking (or anything else for that matter)
Fantastic, thanks Zack
The official issue if you want to follow along <https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/cdc3lwddvz7m>

does anyone have a workaround for HubSpot not letting you search recorded activity on a particular record's page?
I'm thinking either:
• write a little web app our team can go to that basically pulls engagement records into our own database that has better searching
• quicker solution, create a chrome bookmarklet that would auto load the infinite scroll so we can just use ctl+f to easily find stuff on the page.

wasn't sure if either of these have been done or if there's a better option out there. It's so frustrating to be able to search communication of a single customer

Building out some CTA's in HubSpot for an externally hosted website. Is there a decent way to customize the CSS for these any more? I found the Custom CSS section in advanced settings but it seems to leave out the ability to add selectors so there is no way to add hover effects.
you can add a class to the cta and it will use the styles from the website.
That isnt the case with email.
Thanks Chad - this is a separate instance - appreciate it though
apparently this is built into the new beta record view. unfortunately search is not coming up with correct results. guess I'll wait this out and see what happens
Is there a way to see who received notifications from a form submission in the past? The email for a form notification was changed by another user and I want to see what it was before the change.
